Center: US National Nuclear Data Center, Brookhaven, USA
ref: Jour: Journal of the Korean Physical Society, Vol.59, p.1400 (2011)
title: Fission Cross Section Measurements of Actinides at LANSCE

x4freetext: Fission Cross Section Measurements of Actinides at
LANSCE

x4codes.hlp: Los Alamos National Laboratory, NM, United States of America
Idaho National Laboratory, Idaho Falls, ID, United States of America

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Journal of the Korean Physical Society, Vol.59, p.1400 (2011)

x4codes.hlp: Los Alamos National Laboratory, NM, United States of America

x4freetext: Experiment performed at the
spallation neutron source at LANSCE Weapons Neutron
Research (WNR) facility, driven by 800-MeV linear
proton accelerator.
Parallel plate ionization chambers were used
for fission cross section measurements and neutron flux
monitoring. The chambers can hold up to four
samples, and each sample is mounted in identical
geometry in order to perform relative cross section
measurements.
Time of flight was used for neutron energy
determination. Proton beam repetition rate was 20Hz,
each pulse was approx. 250ns wide. Flight path no. 5
was used for cross section measurements with fission
chambers located about 8 meters from spallation target.
Spallation reaction of tungsten target by 800
MeV protons was used as neutron source. A water
moderator shapes the neutron spectrum, and the usable
neutron energy range was from around 0.2 to 200 MeV.
Ratio of unknown cross section to cross section of
235U(n,f) was measured. Ratio was converted to cross
section using the ENDF/B-VII evaluation of
235U(n,f) cross section.
Compiled by S.H.
Preliminary data unobtainable from authors
